question: 101. Please make a note ___ your customer and receipt numbers in case you need to contact us about your order.
102.  If the person you are trying to reach does not answer the telephone, please dial “0” to speak to the ___.
103. Because the boardroom is being painted, the meeting this afternoon will ___ in the conference room on the fourth floor.
104. The monthly rent includes all utilities, with the ___ of telephone and cable charges.
105. An outside auditor will visit the factory next week to determine whether or not ___ air-quality standards are being observed.
106. Effective publicity helps a company keep a high profile by reminding the public of ___ most successful or innovative products.
107. Payment of monthly parking vouchers can be made either by personal check ___ by automatic withdrawal from a bank account.
108. Many problems with locks ___ by a simple repair or adjustment.
109. Seats will be assigned on a first-come, first-served basis, so it would be best to arrive no  ___ than 11:00 A. M.
110. Stewart Packaging Company plans to hire ___ workers because of the increased production quota this month.
111. The company’s establishment of an on-site child care center is intended ___  encourage new parents to return to work.
112. By striving to be neat, well dressed, and cheerful, our representatives can make a good first ___ on our clients.
113. All receipts for travel expenses should be ___ to Mr. Franconi for processing before the end of the month.
114. Whichever of the five new editors seems the ___ experienced with layout will work with Mr. Abdellah on the special edition of the magazine.
115. Because our direct marketing promotion for magazine subscriptions yielded such positive results last year, we plan to do it ___ this year.
116. A fine of $200 will be imposed upon any drivers ___ park illegally downtown during the holiday parade.
117. ___ the new computers are arriving next week, no plans have been made to dispose of the old ones.
118. In Mr. Brothet’s performance review, the department supervisor wrote that he worked extremely ___ and always finished his assignments on time.
119. The leadership conference will be held in Lanesville, which is about 50 miles from downtown Seattle and easily accessible ___ car or train.
120. ___ to the fitness center is free for all employees and their family members.
121. McLellan Associates, the ___ of the two law firms, is presently advertising several job openings for paralegals.
122. Rising gas prices are cutting into our profits, so we ___ to look for alternative delivery methods.
123. Due to the ___ rainfall this spring, water levels in local lakes and rivers are much higher than normal.
124. The Eisenweg Foundation will soon ___ its funding of external scientific research into several new domains, including genetics and endangered languages.
125. The vice chancellor confirmed that the individual points should be presented in ___ of relative priority.
126. Working so many hours of overtime to meet the deadline has left the design staff feeling ___.
127. Winthrop is a dynamic, determined, and articulate person who will succeed in sales ___ he has limited experience in this area of the business.
128. Running a successful art gallery takes more than just a love of art; it also requires a certain business ___ .
129. Manager Tony Lopez is in charge of unloading the merchandise ___ the supply trucks arrive at the supermarket.
130. Jorge was hired as an assistant manager five months ago, and ___ is now in line for a promotion.
131. Formal business attire is required in the office, while more ___ dress is allowed in the workshop.
132. Ever since Mr. Derrick joined the staff, Mr. Zapata and Ms. Coleman have ___ the marketing team for its excellent results.
133. Kline Biochemlcals Is seeking to replace a team of lab technicians with one experienced researcher who is able to handle high-level research projects ___.
134. ___ severe winter weather, affected bus routes may be either redirected or temporarily suspended until the roads are cleared.
135. Employees should feel free to ___ the on-site physician as often as needed.
136. Choosing ___ two very qualified  candidates was not easy, but the board has asked Mr. Diego to be the international school’s next director.
137. Mr. Lee takes his job ___- than his predecessor did.
138. The conference organizers were able to remedy the ___ logistical problems quite efficiently, and guests were impressed by the creative solutions they found.
139. Johnson handled the dispute ___ by holding private discussions in her office.
140. Mobile phones have become ___ prevalent that telecommunications companies are establishing service in areas previously thought too remote.
